items.content_html:
99/366

Obligatory solar eclipse photo from Old Town Alexandria.
items.content_text: # 99/366 Obligatory solar eclipse photo from Old Town Alexandria.

items.content_html:
98/366

The Mutual Ice House used to be one of nine ice houses in Alexandria. It became a plumbing company in the 60s then sat vacant from 1994 until Goodies Frozen Custard moved in a few years ago.
items.content_text: # 98/366 The Mutual Ice House used to be one of nine ice houses in Alexandria. It became a plumbing company in the 60s then sat vacant from 1994 until Goodies Frozen Custard moved in a few years ago.

97/366

The 275th birthday celebration of Alexandria kicked off yesterday at the waterfront. Here is one of the signs in front of the torpedo factory.

96/366

Hitching post in the style of a horse peeking up through the bushes on Franklin Street.

95/366

Old Town Alexandria loves its flags.
items.content_text: # 95/366 Old Town Alexandria loves its flags.

94/366

This home on South Lee Street was originally a church. Even though it looks small, it’s quite large because it has multiple levels in the back.

93/366

The Lee Street rats. This house on the 300 block of South Lee Street regularly has little rats displayed in their basement window. They are currently Easter themed.
items.content_text: # 93/366 The Lee Street rats. This house on the 300 block of South Lee Street regularly has little rats displayed in their basement window. They are currently Easter themed.

92/366

These two yellow, French looking townhomes on the corner of Prince and S Pitt streets are huge.
items.content_text: # 92/366 These two yellow, French looking townhomes on the corner of Prince and S Pitt streets are huge.

91/366

This row of townhomes on N Royal St is dressed in Easter pastels.
items.content_text: # 91/366 This row of townhomes on N Royal St is dressed in Easter pastels.

items.content_html:
90/366

Old Town School for Dogs takes up almost half the block. Besides training, they also have a well stocked pet store and offer grooming services. It’s located at the corner of N Saint Asaph and Oronoco Streets.
items.content_text: # 90/366 Old Town School for Dogs takes up almost half the block. Besides training, they also have a well stocked pet store and offer grooming services. It’s located at the corner of N Saint Asaph and Oronoco Streets.

items.content_html:
89/366

The new public art installation at the waterfront near King St. I think it will steam at some point. It’s meant to represent the asteroid that collided with earth.
items.content_text: # 89/366 The new public art installation at the waterfront near King St. I think it will steam at some point. It’s meant to represent the asteroid that collided with earth.

88/366

This one, more modern townhouse in the midst of older homes.
items.content_text: # 88/366 This one, more modern townhouse in the midst of older homes.

items.content_html:
87/366

This row of townhomes is set back from the sidewalk giving them extra large front yards.
items.content_text: # 87/366 This row of townhomes is set back from the sidewalk giving them extra large front yards.

86/366

Stopped in Beaufort before driving home.
items.content_text: # 86/366 Stopped in Beaufort before driving home.

85/366

Spent the day in Hilton Head and Bluffton.

84/366

Spent the day in Savannah GA.

83/366

Drove down to South Carolina to visit family. There’s a Buc-ees in Florence, so of course we had to stop.
items.content_text: # 83/366 Drove down to South Carolina to visit family. There’s a Buc-ees in Florence, so of course we had to stop.

items.content_html:
82/366

Dinner at a Mexican food restaurant in Del Ray. Del Ray is a neighborhood of Alexandria where the town of Potomac used to be.
items.content_text: # 82/366 Dinner at a Mexican food restaurant in Del Ray. Del Ray is a neighborhood of Alexandria where the town of Potomac used to be.

items.content_html:
81/366

This old tobacco warehouse at the corner of Prince St and S Union St still has ghost paint all over the side.
items.content_text: # 81/366 This old tobacco warehouse at the corner of Prince St and S Union St still has ghost paint all over the side.

items.content_html:
80/366

Two V-22 Ospreys flying south while the Alexandria City Titans crew team rows north on the Potomac.
items.content_text: # 80/366 Two V-22 Ospreys flying south while the Alexandria City Titans crew team rows north on the Potomac.

items.content_html:
79/366

The Martin V. B. Bostetter Jr. United States Courthouse is the US Bankruptcy court for the Eastern district. Named after one of the longest serving bankruptcy court chief justices, Bostetter spent his entire legal career within an eight block radius of this courthouse.
items.content_text: # 79/366 The Martin V. B. Bostetter Jr. United States Courthouse is the US Bankruptcy court for the Eastern district. Named after one of the longest serving bankruptcy court chief justices, Bostetter spent his entire legal career within an eight block radius of this courthouse.

items.content_html:
78/366

I don’t know the story behind this house on Gibbon St. But it has FOUR exterior doors on the front. Was it multiple units turned into one place? Strange.
items.content_text: # 78/366 I don’t know the story behind this house on Gibbon St. But it has FOUR exterior doors on the front. Was it multiple units turned into one place? Strange.

items.content_html:
77/366

The Jones Point Lighthouse is a National Park. It’s one of the last riverine lighthouses in the US and the last still standing in the Chesapeake Bay watershed. It’s approximately one mile south of King Street in Old Town and hidden well enough to be easily missed.
items.content_text: # 77/366 The Jones Point Lighthouse is a National Park. It’s one of the last riverine lighthouses in the US and the last still standing in the Chesapeake Bay watershed. It’s approximately one mile south of King Street in Old Town and hidden well enough to be easily missed.

items.content_html:
76/366

Princess St between Saint Asaph and Washington is still cobblestone. The only other cobblestone street in old town is Prince St closer to the water.
items.content_text: # 76/366 Princess St between Saint Asaph and Washington is still cobblestone. The only other cobblestone street in old town is Prince St closer to the water.

items.content_html:
75/366

This is a horse block. Used in days past to easily mount a horse or carriage. There are many different shapes and sizes of them still found around Old Town.
items.content_text: # 75/366 This is a horse block. Used in days past to easily mount a horse or carriage. There are many different shapes and sizes of them still found around Old Town.

items.content_html:
74/366

Which way to the waterfront? The McIlhenny Sport Center in the back, home of the Alexandria Seaport Foundation where young people can learn woodworking, boat building, and other skills.
items.content_text: # 74/366 Which way to the waterfront? The McIlhenny Sport Center in the back, home of the Alexandria Seaport Foundation where young people can learn woodworking, boat building, and other skills.

73/366

South Lee St. overlooking Windmill Hill Park. These homes have a great view of the Potomac.
items.content_text: # 73/366 South Lee St. overlooking Windmill Hill Park. These homes have a great view of the Potomac.

72/366

Looking across the Wilkes Tunnel at a row of townhomes.
items.content_text: # 72/366 Looking across the Wilkes Tunnel at a row of townhomes.

71/366

I wonder who was kept in this dungeon…
items.content_text: # 71/366 I wonder who was kept in this dungeon…

70/366

Looking down Cameron St. to Christ Church; an episcopal church that was built in 1773 and designed by Col. James Wren, son of Sir Christopher Wren. Many notable people have attended service including George Washington and Winston Churchill.
items.content_text: # 70/366 Looking down Cameron St. to Christ Church; an episcopal church that was built in 1773 and designed by Col. James Wren, son of Sir Christopher Wren. Many notable people have attended service including George Washington and Winston Churchill.

69/366

Spotted between neighboring townhomes on Wilkes.
items.content_text: # 69/366 Spotted between neighboring townhomes on Wilkes.

68/366

You never know what little embellishments you might find around town. Keep your eyes peeled!
items.content_text: # 68/366 You never know what little embellishments you might find around town. Keep your eyes peeled!

items.content_html:
67/366

Sunset over townhomes on Quay St. from Founders Park.
items.content_text: # 67/366 Sunset over townhomes on Quay St. from Founders Park.

items.content_html:
66/366

Not everything in Old Town is old. Robinson Landing condominiums have an amazing waterfront view/location.
items.content_text: # 66/366 Not everything in Old Town is old. Robinson Landing condominiums have an amazing waterfront view/location.

65/366

Millstone used as part of the sidewalk at Wilkes and S Washington.

64/366

Sunset over Old Town.

63/366

Spring is giving it a go.

Photo courtesy of the wife.

62/366

Corner of South Lee St and Duke St.

61/366

Sunrise over the Potomac
items.content_text: # 61/366 Sunrise over the Potomac

items.content_html:
60/366

The Presbyterian Meeting House. The original was built in 1775. Lightning struck the tower in 1835 and nearly burned the entire structure. This is the replacement, still in use today. You can find the Tomb of the Unknown Revolutionary Soldier in the graveyard out back.
items.content_text: # 60/366 The Presbyterian Meeting House. The original was built in 1775. Lightning struck the tower in 1835 and nearly burned the entire structure. This is the replacement, still in use today. You can find the Tomb of the Unknown Revolutionary Soldier in the graveyard out back.

items.content_html:
59/366

I don’t know the story behind these two townhomes on South Lee St. But I like them.
items.content_text: # 59/366 I don’t know the story behind these two townhomes on South Lee St. But I like them.

items.content_html:
58/366

According to the sign above the door, this is the Honeycomb House on Wolfe St.
items.content_text: # 58/366 According to the sign above the door, this is the Honeycomb House on Wolfe St.

items.content_html:
57/366

The Tannery Yard townhomes sit where the C C Smoot and Co. Tannery used to be. Smoot owned the Tannery, a lumber yard, and was mayor of Alexandria in the early 1800s.
items.content_text: # 57/366 The Tannery Yard townhomes sit where the C C Smoot and Co. Tannery used to be. Smoot owned the Tannery, a lumber yard, and was mayor of Alexandria in the early 1800s.

items.content_html:
56/366

The Friendship Fire Company was established here in 1774 and was the first volunteer fire company in Alexandria. The building is now a museum dedicated to the history of firefighting.
items.content_text: # 56/366 The Friendship Fire Company was established here in 1774 and was the first volunteer fire company in Alexandria. The building is now a museum dedicated to the history of firefighting.

items.content_html:
55/366

The Vowell-Smith house is the largest house in Old Town Alexandria. And from this angle it looks reeeeal spooky.
items.content_text: # 55/366 The Vowell-Smith house is the largest house in Old Town Alexandria. And from this angle it looks reeeeal spooky.

items.content_html:
54/366

They love their arches here.
items.content_text: # 54/366 They love their arches here.

items.content_html:
53/366

I wonder if they need a parking permit for the moped?
items.content_text: # 53/366 I wonder if they need a parking permit for the moped?

items.content_html:
52/366

The Ramsay House is the oldest house in Alexandria. Built in 1749 by William Ramsay, a founder of Alexandria and the first mayor. It was restored in 1956 and is now the visitor center.
items.content_text: # 52/366 The Ramsay House is the oldest house in Alexandria. Built in 1749 by William Ramsay, a founder of Alexandria and the first mayor. It was restored in 1956 and is now the visitor center.

items.content_html:
51/366

The wife snapped this on our evening walk with the dogs. King Street looking west from the waterfront towards the George Washington Masonic Memorial.
items.content_text: # 51/366 The wife snapped this on our evening walk with the dogs. King Street looking west from the waterfront towards the George Washington Masonic Memorial.

items.content_html:
50/366

Today is Presidents‘ Day, officially Washington’s Birthday to the federal government. It would be Washington’s 292nd birthday. It’s also the 275th year since Alexandria was founded. We watched the parade today.
items.content_text: # 50/366 Today is Presidents‘ Day, officially Washington’s Birthday to the federal government. It would be Washington’s 292nd birthday. It’s also the 275th year since Alexandria was founded. We watched the parade today.

items.content_html:
49/366

The Old Dominion Boat Club was founded in 1880. In 1947 they started a high school rowing program at the city’s high school. It’s the second oldest boat club in Virginia and sits at the end of Prince Street.
items.content_text: # 49/366 The Old Dominion Boat Club was founded in 1880. In 1947 they started a high school rowing program at the city’s high school. It’s the second oldest boat club in Virginia and sits at the end of Prince Street.

items.content_html:
48/366

We were supposed to get snow last night. 501 Duke St was built in 1780 and once owned by George Washington’s nephew. As you can see, it is completely uncovered in snow.
items.content_text: # 48/366 We were supposed to get snow last night. 501 Duke St was built in 1780 and once owned by George Washington’s nephew. As you can see, it is completely uncovered in snow.

items.content_html:
47/366

This downspout is marked with the TW & RC Smith foundry name and “Alexandria DC”. Alexandria was returned to Virginia in 1846, so the downspout is almost 180 years old.
items.content_text: # 47/366 This downspout is marked with the TW & RC Smith foundry name and “Alexandria DC”. Alexandria was returned to Virginia in 1846, so the downspout is almost 180 years old.

items.content_html:
46/366

The Benevolent and Protective Order of the Elks (BPOE) headquarters was built in 1910. In the 80s it was sold to developers and turned into condos. The mayor of Alexandria convinced the Elks to leave the statue as part of the architecture of Old Town.
items.content_text: # 46/366 The Benevolent and Protective Order of the Elks (BPOE) headquarters was built in 1910. In the 80s it was sold to developers and turned into condos. The mayor of Alexandria convinced the Elks to leave the statue as part of the architecture of Old Town.

items.content_html:
45/366

Little Theater of Alexandria (LTA) is the local community theater. Founded in 1934, they’ve produced almost 400 shows.
items.content_text: # 45/366 Little Theater of Alexandria (LTA) is the local community theater. Founded in 1934, they’ve produced almost 400 shows.

items.content_html:
44/366

The Columbia Firehouse on South Saint Asaph was home to the Columbia Steam Engine Fire Company in 1871. In 2009 it became the Columbia Firehouse restaurant. In 2023 they relaunched as Josephine Brasserie, a delicious French restaurant where we have Valentine’s reservations!
items.content_text: # 44/366 The Columbia Firehouse on South Saint Asaph was home to the Columbia Steam Engine Fire Company in 1871. In 2009 it became the Columbia Firehouse restaurant. In 2023 they relaunched as Josephine Brasserie, a delicious French restaurant where we have Valentine’s reservations!

items.content_html:
43/366

We have a lot of brick sidewalks in Old Town. And most of them are NOT flat.
items.content_text: # 43/366 We have a lot of brick sidewalks in Old Town. And most of them are NOT flat.

items.content_html:
42/366

Nothing especially historic about these homes that I’m aware of. Just a whole lotta brick and cute doors.
items.content_text: # 42/366 Nothing especially historic about these homes that I’m aware of. Just a whole lotta brick and cute doors.

items.content_html:
41/366

Gadsby’s Tavern sits on the corner of Royal and Cameron streets. George Washington was a frequent visitor and the tavern has hosted other famous people like John Adams, Thomas Jefferson, and Lafayette. It’s now a museum and restaurant.
items.content_text: # 41/366 Gadsby’s Tavern sits on the corner of Royal and Cameron streets. George Washington was a frequent visitor and the tavern has hosted other famous people like John Adams, Thomas Jefferson, and Lafayette. It’s now a museum and restaurant.

items.content_html:
40/366

Underneath the Woodrow Wilson bridge at Jones Point Park.
items.content_text: # 40/366 Underneath the Woodrow Wilson bridge at Jones Point Park.

items.content_html:
39/366

There’s always a cause to fight in Old Town.
items.content_text: # 39/366 There’s always a cause to fight in Old Town.

items.content_html:
38/366

Originally the Second Presbyterian Church, built in 1840, the building at 601 Prince St has also housed a civil war hospital, the Virginia Tech Washington-Alexandria Architecture Center, and is now the Alexandria Economic Development Partnership.
items.content_text: # 38/366 Originally the Second Presbyterian Church, built in 1840, the building at 601 Prince St has also housed a civil war hospital, the Virginia Tech Washington-Alexandria Architecture Center, and is now the Alexandria Economic Development Partnership.

items.content_html:
37/366

King Street trolley is free and runs every fifteen minutes from the King Street metro station to City Hall near the waterfront.
items.content_text: # 37/366 King Street trolley is free and runs every fifteen minutes from the King Street metro station to City Hall near the waterfront.

items.content_html:
36/366

The rooflines of these three townhouses is interesting.
items.content_text: # 36/366 The rooflines of these three townhouses is interesting.

items.content_html:
35/366

The tall ship Providence is a sloop anchored in Alexandria on the Potomac between Prince and King streets. Records of the ship’s first voyages start in 1769. You can learn about the ship and even take a sunset sail during part of the year.
items.content_text: # 35/366 The tall ship Providence is a sloop anchored in Alexandria on the Potomac between Prince and King streets. Records of the ship’s first voyages start in 1769. You can learn about the ship and even take a sunset sail during part of the year.

items.content_html:
34/366

The Basilica St. Mary’s bell tower. BSM is the oldest Roman Catholic Church in Virginia. Founded in 1795.
items.content_text: # 34/366 The Basilica St. Mary’s bell tower. BSM is the oldest Roman Catholic Church in Virginia. Founded in 1795.

items.content_html:
33/366

Many of the homes in Old Town have gas lamps.
items.content_text: # 33/366 Many of the homes in Old Town have gas lamps.

items.content_html:
32/366

Even though we’re in the middle of a historic district, it’s still just a regular neighborhood with regular shopping and grocery stores.
items.content_text: # 32/366 Even though we’re in the middle of a historic district, it’s still just a regular neighborhood with regular shopping and grocery stores.

items.content_html:
31/366

The house on the left looks like it’s made of stone blocks. It actually has the same treatment that Mount Vernon does. They used planks of wood shaped like blocks, then they mix sand in with the paint to give it a stone-like texture.
items.content_text: # 31/366 The house on the left looks like it’s made of stone blocks. It actually has the same treatment that Mount Vernon does. They used planks of wood shaped like blocks, then they mix sand in with the paint to give it a stone-like texture.

items.content_html:
30/366

Cur non? On October 12, 1824 Major General Marquis de Lafayette, soldier, statesman, citizen of France and of the United States was the guest of the city of Alexandria and with his suite was domiciled in this house. Erected by the American friends of Lafayette May 11, 1963
items.content_text: # 30/366 Cur non? On October 12, 1824 Major General Marquis de Lafayette, soldier, statesman, citizen of France and of the United States was the guest of the city of Alexandria and with his suite was domiciled in this house. Erected by the American friends of Lafayette May 11, 1963

items.content_html:
29/366

I didn’t get a chance to get out during daylight today. So I’ll share a photo of my library wall in my home office; recently reorganized.
items.content_text: # 29/366 I didn’t get a chance to get out during daylight today. So I’ll share a photo of my library wall in my home office; recently reorganized.

items.content_html:
28/366

The Tunnel Flats. A group of one bedroom apartments right at the entrance to the Wilkes Tunnel. Not pictured here, but there’s a cute little courtyard on the inside.
items.content_text: # 28/366 The Tunnel Flats. A group of one bedroom apartments right at the entrance to the Wilkes Tunnel. Not pictured here, but there’s a cute little courtyard on the inside.

27/366

So many great front steps in Old Town.
items.content_text: # 27/366 So many great front steps in Old Town.

26/366

Engine 201 at AFD station 201 in Old Town.
items.content_text: # 26/366 Engine 201 at AFD station 201 in Old Town.

25/366

Foggy night and it’s creeping up through the Wilkes Street tunnel. Photo stolen from the wife.
items.content_text: # 25/366 Foggy night and it’s creeping up through the Wilkes Street tunnel. Photo stolen from the wife.

items.content_html:
24/366

It sure is a bright yellow! But it must be historically accurate. The plaque on the front means it was granted Early Building status. Which means they’re subject to specific rules for painting.
items.content_text: # 24/366 It sure is a bright yellow! But it must be historically accurate. The plaque on the front means it was granted Early Building status. Which means they’re subject to specific rules for painting.

23/366

Our local, tiny USPS mailbox.
items.content_text: # 23/366 Our local, tiny USPS mailbox.

22/366

Snow (sand) volleyball court at Windmill Hill park with townhomes on South Lee St at the top of the park.
items.content_text: # 22/366 Snow (sand) volleyball court at Windmill Hill park with townhomes on South Lee St at the top of the park.

21/366

Alexandria has its own version of Painted Ladies too.
items.content_text: # 21/366 Alexandria has its own version of Painted Ladies too.

20/366

A transformer blew out across the street. The fire department had to just watch the pole on fire until the electric company came to turn off the power.
items.content_text: # 20/366 A transformer blew out across the street. The fire department had to just watch the pole on fire until the electric company came to turn off the power.

items.content_html:
19/366

The Athenaeum was built about 1851 and originally housed the Bank of the Old Dominion. During the civil war it was a commissary for Union officers. Now it’s home to the Northern Virginia Fine Arts Association (NVFAA); hosting art exhibitions, concerts, etc.
items.content_text: # 19/366 The Athenaeum was built about 1851 and originally housed the Bank of the Old Dominion. During the civil war it was a commissary for Union officers. Now it’s home to the Northern Virginia Fine Arts Association (NVFAA); hosting art exhibitions, concerts, etc.

items.content_html:
18/366

One of many alleys around the city. This one connects all the way to the next block.
items.content_text: # 18/366 One of many alleys around the city. This one connects all the way to the next block.

items.content_html:
17/366

The farther south you get from King Street, the larger the houses and/or yards.
items.content_text: # 17/366 The farther south you get from King Street, the larger the houses and/or yards.

items.content_html:
16/366

Still cold and snowy. But turning to ice now.
items.content_text: # 16/366 Still cold and snowy. But turning to ice now.

items.content_html:
15/366

Our first snow since living here. Turns out a layer of snow just makes the city even more charming.
items.content_text: # 15/366 Our first snow since living here. Turns out a layer of snow just makes the city even more charming.

items.content_html:
14/366

Morning train back to DC.
items.content_text: # 14/366 Morning train back to DC.

items.content_html:
13/366

Quick weekend trip to NYC with the wife to celebrate our anniversary (which was a couple months ago). Spent Saturday at Strand, Kinokuniya, Morgan Library Museum, dinner at Oscar Wilde, and watched “Spamalot.”
items.content_text: # 13/366 Quick weekend trip to NYC with the wife to celebrate our anniversary (which was a couple months ago). Spent Saturday at Strand, Kinokuniya, Morgan Library Museum, dinner at Oscar Wilde, and watched “Spamalot.”

items.content_html:
12/366

Quick weekend trip to NYC with the wife to celebrate our anniversary (which was a couple months ago). Spent Friday on the train with a 2+ hour delay in Philadelphia. Then dinner and we saw “Merrily We Roll Along.”
items.content_text: # 12/366 Quick weekend trip to NYC with the wife to celebrate our anniversary (which was a couple months ago). Spent Friday on the train with a 2+ hour delay in Philadelphia. Then dinner and we saw “Merrily We Roll Along.”

items.content_html:
11/366

This house on South Pitt St. looks like somebody removed a house next door.
items.content_text: # 11/366 This house on South Pitt St. looks like somebody removed a house next door.

items.content_html:
10/366

We had some pretty bad wind and rain last night. On the walk along the waterfront tonight, we found the remains of the high water level.
items.content_text: # 10/366 We had some pretty bad wind and rain last night. On the walk along the waterfront tonight, we found the remains of the high water level.

items.content_html:
9/366

The original lots available in Alexandria in the late 1700s were quarter blocks. Over time those divided into smaller plots. You can find homes where they divided the lot and the next available street address was already taken. So they were left with half and three-quarters of an address.
items.content_text: # 9/366 The original lots available in Alexandria in the late 1700s were quarter blocks. Over time those divided into smaller plots. You can find homes where they divided the lot and the next available street address was already taken. So they were left with half and three-quarters of an address.

items.content_html:
8/366

This house on Duke Street looks like something off a Scooby Doo episode.
items.content_text: # 8/366 This house on Duke Street looks like something off a Scooby Doo episode.

items.content_html:
7/366

The Chewish Deli is nestled in the northwest quadrant of Old Town. The founder was a hobby baker who started with restaurant partnerships and now owns two locations and a food truck. You can tell if they’re open because there’s always a line out front.
items.content_text: # 7/366 The Chewish Deli is nestled in the northwest quadrant of Old Town. The founder was a hobby baker who started with restaurant partnerships and now owns two locations and a food truck. You can tell if they’re open because there’s always a line out front.

items.content_html:
6/366

This is a full sized door but almost half is below sidewalk level. I don’t know if it’s used or not, but I like to imagine it is and the owner just climbs down into the room.
items.content_text: # 6/366 This is a full sized door but almost half is below sidewalk level. I don’t know if it’s used or not, but I like to imagine it is and the owner just climbs down into the room.

items.content_html:
5/366

One can just make out the ghost sign on the side of this townhouse that reads “Chew Grape”. This home was once a grocery store and Grape was a brand of chewing tobacco in the late 19th century.
items.content_text: # 5/366 One can just make out the ghost sign on the side of this townhouse that reads “Chew Grape”. This home was once a grocery store and Grape was a brand of chewing tobacco in the late 19th century.

items.content_html:
4/366

The Historic Alexandria Foundation began issuing these plaques to buildings in the historic district in 1970. To be awarded a plaque a house must be at least 100 years old and retain “architectural integrity” by the foundation’s standards.
items.content_text: # 4/366 The Historic Alexandria Foundation began issuing these plaques to buildings in the historic district in 1970. To be awarded a plaque a house must be at least 100 years old and retain “architectural integrity” by the foundation’s standards.

items.content_html:

items.title: 2024 Project 366
items.content_html:
I’ve been doing a “Project 365” for several years now. In 2023 I switched it up and did a “Project 52”. I ended up puttering out towards the end of the year because life got busy. I’m back to try another year of photos every day.

Last year, the wife and I moved to Old Town Alexandria. So, I’m going to try to focus on this awesome little city this year. Hope you enjoy!
items.content_text:
I've been doing a "[Project 365](https://notunremarkable.me/project-365/)" for several years now. In 2023 I switched it up and did a "Project 52". I ended up puttering out towards the end of the year because life got busy. I'm back to try another year of photos every day. 

Last year, the wife and I moved to [Old Town Alexandria](https://visitalexandria.com/old-town/). So, I'm going to try to focus on this awesome little city this year. Hope you enjoy!
